parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each member

returnParameters.description: new array containing result of applying parameter `func` to each member of parameter `arr` in order

functions.name: 'map
functions.description:
Applies a function to each member of an array and returns an array of the results.

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [0, 1, 2];
numbers.map(n => n * 2) ⇒ [0,2,4]
```

returnParameters.description: array of index, member pairs

functions.name: enumerate
functions.description:
Returns a new array consisting of index and member pairs.

```ballerina
[1, 2, 3, 4].enumerate() ⇒ [[0,1],[1,2],[2,3],[3,4]]
```

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: function to apply to each member

returnParameters.description: true if applying parameter func returns true for every member of `arr`; otherwise, false

functions.name: every
functions.description:
Tests whether a function returns true for every member of an array.

The parameter `func` is called for each member of `arr` in order unless and until a call returns false.
When the array is empty, returns true.

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [1, 2, 3, 5];
numbers.every(n => n % 2 == 0) ⇒ false
```

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a predicate to apply to each member to test whether it should be selected

returnParameters.description: new array only containing members of parameter `arr` for which parameter `func` evaluates to true

functions.name: filter
functions.description:
Selects the members from an array for which a function returns true.

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [12, 43, 60, 75, 10];
numbers.filter(n => n > 50) ⇒ [60,75]
```

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each member

functions.name: forEach

returnParameters.description: the byte array or error

functions.name: fromBase16
functions.description:
Returns the byte array that a string represents in Base16.

`str` must consist of the characters `0..9`, `A..F`, `a..f`
and whitespace as allowed by a Ballerina Base16Literal.

```ballerina
array:fromBase16("aaabcfccadafcd") ⇒ [170,171,207,204,173,175,205]
array:fromBase16("aaabcfccadafcd==") ⇒ error
```

returnParameters.description: the byte array or error

functions.name: fromBase64
functions.description:
Returns the byte array that a string represents in Base64.

parameter `str` must consist of the characters `A..Z`, `a..z`, `0..9`, `+`, `/`, `=`
and whitespace as allowed by a Ballerina Base64Literal.

```ballerina
array:fromBase64("aGVsbG8gYmE=") ⇒ [104,101,108,108,111,32,98,97]
array:fromBase64("aGVsbG8gYmE--") ⇒ error
```

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: index to start the search from

returnParameters.description: index of the member if found, else `()`

functions.name: indexOf
functions.description:
Returns the index of first member of an array that is equal to a given value if there is one.
Returns `()` if not found.
Equality is tested using `==`.

```ballerina
string[] strings = ["a", "b", "d", "b", "d"];
strings.indexOf("e") is () ⇒ true
strings.indexOf("b") ⇒ 1
strings.indexOf("b", 2) ⇒ 3
```

returnParameters.description: a new iterator object that will iterate over the members of parameter `arr`

functions.name: iterator

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: index to start searching backwards from

returnParameters.description: index of the member if found, else `()`

functions.name: lastIndexOf
functions.description:
Returns the index of last member of an array that is equal to a given value if there is one.
Returns `()` if not found.
Equality is tested using `==`.

```ballerina
string[] strings = ["a", "b", "d", "b", "d", "b"];
strings.lastIndexOf("e") is () ⇒ true
strings.lastIndexOf("b") ⇒ 5
strings.lastIndexOf("b", strings.length() - 2) ⇒ 3
```

returnParameters.description: number of members in parameter `arr`

functions.name: length
functions.description:
Returns the number of members of an array.

```ballerina
["a", "b", "c", "d"].length() ⇒ 4
```

returnParameters.description: removed member

functions.name: pop
functions.description:
Removes and returns the last member of an array.

The array must not be empty.

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [2, 4, 6, 8, 10];
numbers.pop() ⇒ 10
int[] values = [];
values.pop() ⇒ panic
```

parameters.name: vals
parameters.description: values to add to the end of the array

functions.name: push

parameters.name: initial
parameters.description: initial value for the first argument of combining parameter `func`

returnParameters.description:
result of combining the members of parameter `arr` using parameter `func`
For example
is the same as `sum(1, 2, 3)`.

functions.name: reduce
functions.description:
Combines the members of an array using a combining function.

The combining function takes the combined value so far and a member of the array,
and returns a new combined value.

```ballerina
[1, 2, 3].reduce(isolated function (int total, int next) returns int => total + next, 0) ⇒ 6
```

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: index of member to be removed from parameter `arr`

returnParameters.description: the member of parameter `arr` that was at parameter `index`

functions.name: remove
functions.description:
Removes a member of an array.

This removes the member of parameter `arr` with index parameter `index` and returns it.
It panics if there is no such member.

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [2, 4, 6, 8];
numbers.remove(1) ⇒ 4
numbers.remove(7) ⇒ panic
```

functions.name: removeAll

returnParameters.description: parameter `arr` with its members in reverse order

functions.name: reverse
functions.description:
Reverses the order of the members of an array.

```ballerina
[2, 4, 12, 8, 10].reverse() ⇒ [10,8,12,4,2]
```

parameters.name: arr
parameters.description: the array of which to change the length

functions.name: setLength

returnParameters.description: the value that was the first member of the array

functions.name: shift
functions.description:
Removes and returns first member of an array.

The array must not be empty.

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [2, 4, 6, 8, 10];
numbers.shift() ⇒ 2
int[] values = [];
values.shift() ⇒ panic
```

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: index of first member to include in the slice

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.description: index of first member not to include in the slice

returnParameters.description: array slice within specified range

functions.name: slice
functions.description:
Returns a subarray using a start index (inclusive) and an end index (exclusive).

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12];
numbers.slice(3) ⇒ [8,10,12]
numbers.slice(0, 4) ⇒ [2,4,6,8]
numbers.slice(0, 10) ⇒ panic
```

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: function to apply to each member

returnParameters.description: true if applying parameter `func` returns true for some member of `arr`; otherwise, false

functions.name: some
functions.description:
Tests whether a function returns true for some member of an array.

The parameter `func` is called for each member of parameter `arr` in order unless and until a call returns true.
When the array is empty, returns false.

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [1, 2, 3, 5];
numbers.some(n => n % 2 == 0) ⇒ true
```

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: function that returns a key to use to sort the members

returnParameters.description: a new array consisting of the members of parameter `arr` in sorted order

functions.name: sort
functions.description:
Sorts an array.

If the member type of the array is not ordered, then the parameter `key` function
must be specified.
Sorting works the same as with the parameter `sort` clause of query expressions.

```ballerina
string[] strings = ["c", "a", "B"];
strings.sort() ⇒ ["B","a","c"]
strings.sort("descending") ⇒ ["c","a","B"]
strings.sort(key = string:toLowerAscii) ⇒ ["a","B","c"]
strings.sort("descending", string:toLowerAscii) ⇒ ["c","B","a"]
```

returnParameters.description: Base16 string representation

functions.name: toBase16
functions.description:
Returns the string that is the Base16 representation of an array of bytes.

The representation is the same as used by a Ballerina Base16Literal.
The result will contain only characters  `0..9`, `a..f`.
There will be no whitespace in the returned string.

```ballerina
byte[] byteArray = [170, 171, 207, 204, 173, 175, 205];
byteArray.toBase16() ⇒ aaabcfccadafcd
```

returnParameters.description: Base64 string representation

functions.name: toBase64
functions.description:
Returns the string that is the Base64 representation of an array of bytes.

The representation is the same as used by a Ballerina Base64Literal.
The result will contain only characters  `A..Z`, `a..z`, `0..9`, `+`, `/` and `=`.
There will be no whitespace in the returned string.

```ballerina
byte[] byteArray = [104, 101, 108, 108, 111, 32, 98, 97];
byteArray.toBase64() ⇒ aGVsbG8gYmE=
```

parameters.name: arr
parameters.description: The array from which the stream is created

returnParameters.description:
The stream representation of the array `arr`
The returned stream will use an iterator over `arr` and
will therefore handle mutation of `arr` in the same way
as an iterator does.

functions.name: toStream

parameters.name: vals
parameters.description: values to add to the start of the array

functions.name: unshift

types.name: AnydataType
types.description:
A type parameter that is a subtype of `anydata|error`.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.

types.name: OrderedType
types.description: Any ordered type is a subtype of this.

types.name: Type
types.description:
A type parameter that is a subtype of `any|error`.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.

types.name: Type1
types.description:
A type parameter that is a subtype of `any|error`.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.

modules.summary: The `lang.array` module corresponds to the `list` basic type.
modules.description:
## Module overview

The `lang.array` module corresponds to the `list` basic type.
The `lang.array` module corresponds to the `list` basic type.

functions.description:
Applies a function to each member of an array and returns an array of the results.

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [0, 1, 2];
numbers.map(n => n * 2) ⇒ [0,2,4]
```

Returns a new array consisting of index and member pairs.

```ballerina
[1, 2, 3, 4].enumerate() ⇒ [[0,1],[1,2],[2,3],[3,4]]
```

Tests whether a function returns true for every member of an array.

The parameter `func` is called for each member of `arr` in order unless and until a call returns false.
When the array is empty, returns true.

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [1, 2, 3, 5];
numbers.every(n => n % 2 == 0) ⇒ false
```

Selects the members from an array for which a function returns true.

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [12, 43, 60, 75, 10];
numbers.filter(n => n > 50) ⇒ [60,75]
```

Returns the byte array that a string represents in Base16.

`str` must consist of the characters `0..9`, `A..F`, `a..f`
and whitespace as allowed by a Ballerina Base16Literal.

```ballerina
array:fromBase16("aaabcfccadafcd") ⇒ [170,171,207,204,173,175,205]
array:fromBase16("aaabcfccadafcd==") ⇒ error
```

Returns the byte array that a string represents in Base64.

parameter `str` must consist of the characters `A..Z`, `a..z`, `0..9`, `+`, `/`, `=`
and whitespace as allowed by a Ballerina Base64Literal.

```ballerina
array:fromBase64("aGVsbG8gYmE=") ⇒ [104,101,108,108,111,32,98,97]
array:fromBase64("aGVsbG8gYmE--") ⇒ error
```

Returns the index of first member of an array that is equal to a given value if there is one.
Returns `()` if not found.
Equality is tested using `==`.

```ballerina
string[] strings = ["a", "b", "d", "b", "d"];
strings.indexOf("e") is () ⇒ true
strings.indexOf("b") ⇒ 1
strings.indexOf("b", 2) ⇒ 3
```

Returns the index of last member of an array that is equal to a given value if there is one.
Returns `()` if not found.
Equality is tested using `==`.

```ballerina
string[] strings = ["a", "b", "d", "b", "d", "b"];
strings.lastIndexOf("e") is () ⇒ true
strings.lastIndexOf("b") ⇒ 5
strings.lastIndexOf("b", strings.length() - 2) ⇒ 3
```

Returns the number of members of an array.

```ballerina
["a", "b", "c", "d"].length() ⇒ 4
```

Removes and returns the last member of an array.

The array must not be empty.

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [2, 4, 6, 8, 10];
numbers.pop() ⇒ 10
int[] values = [];
values.pop() ⇒ panic
```

Combines the members of an array using a combining function.

The combining function takes the combined value so far and a member of the array,
and returns a new combined value.

```ballerina
[1, 2, 3].reduce(isolated function (int total, int next) returns int => total + next, 0) ⇒ 6
```

Removes a member of an array.

This removes the member of parameter `arr` with index parameter `index` and returns it.
It panics if there is no such member.

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [2, 4, 6, 8];
numbers.remove(1) ⇒ 4
numbers.remove(7) ⇒ panic
```

Reverses the order of the members of an array.

```ballerina
[2, 4, 12, 8, 10].reverse() ⇒ [10,8,12,4,2]
```

Removes and returns first member of an array.

The array must not be empty.

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [2, 4, 6, 8, 10];
numbers.shift() ⇒ 2
int[] values = [];
values.shift() ⇒ panic
```

Returns a subarray using a start index (inclusive) and an end index (exclusive).

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12];
numbers.slice(3) ⇒ [8,10,12]
numbers.slice(0, 4) ⇒ [2,4,6,8]
numbers.slice(0, 10) ⇒ panic
```

Tests whether a function returns true for some member of an array.

The parameter `func` is called for each member of parameter `arr` in order unless and until a call returns true.
When the array is empty, returns false.

```ballerina
int[] numbers = [1, 2, 3, 5];
numbers.some(n => n % 2 == 0) ⇒ true
```

Sorts an array.

If the member type of the array is not ordered, then the parameter `key` function
must be specified.
Sorting works the same as with the parameter `sort` clause of query expressions.

```ballerina
string[] strings = ["c", "a", "B"];
strings.sort() ⇒ ["B","a","c"]
strings.sort("descending") ⇒ ["c","a","B"]
strings.sort(key = string:toLowerAscii) ⇒ ["a","B","c"]
strings.sort("descending", string:toLowerAscii) ⇒ ["c","B","a"]
```

Returns the string that is the Base16 representation of an array of bytes.

The representation is the same as used by a Ballerina Base16Literal.
The result will contain only characters  `0..9`, `a..f`.
There will be no whitespace in the returned string.

```ballerina
byte[] byteArray = [170, 171, 207, 204, 173, 175, 205];
byteArray.toBase16() ⇒ aaabcfccadafcd
```

Returns the string that is the Base64 representation of an array of bytes.

The representation is the same as used by a Ballerina Base64Literal.
The result will contain only characters  `A..Z`, `a..z`, `0..9`, `+`, `/` and `=`.
There will be no whitespace in the returned string.

```ballerina
byte[] byteArray = [104, 101, 108, 108, 111, 32, 98, 97];
byteArray.toBase64() ⇒ aGVsbG8gYmE=
```

types.description:
A type parameter that is a subtype of `anydata|error`.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.
Any ordered type is a subtype of this.

A type parameter that is a subtype of `any|error`.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.

A type parameter that is a subtype of `any|error`.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.
